Graham DeLoach
Bill Satcher | past_members = Zach Brown }} '''A Thousand Horses''' is an American [[country music]] band formed in 2010 in [[Nashville, Tennessee]]. The band is composed of Michael Hobby (lead vocals), Bill Satcher (lead guitar), and Graham Deloach (bass and vocals); Zach Brown (guitar, vocals) was also a member until leaving in 2023. Their first [[extended play|EP]], ''A Thousand Horses'', was released under [[Interscope Records]] in 2010. In 2014, the band signed with [[Republic Nashville]] of [[Big Machine Label Group]] and released its first single "[[Smoke (A Thousand Horses song)|Smoke]]", which set a record for the highest debut by a new act when it opened at number 28 on the Country Aircheck radio chart.{{cite news|last1=Bjorke|first1=Matt|title=A Thousand Horses' "Smoke" Makes Radio History|url=http://roughstock.com/news/2015/01/32298-thousand-horses-smoke-makes-radio-history/|accessdate=January 26, 2015|work=Roughstock|date=January 23, 2015}} ==Biography== Michael Hobby and Bill Satcher grew up in [[Newberry, South Carolina]], where they began writing songs at the age of 15. Satcher's cousin and [[Savannah, Georgia]], native Graham DeLoach joined the duo soon after. A friend eventually introduced Atlanta native Zach Brown, and A Thousand Horses was formed. The name "A Thousand Horses" came from a song on their first EP.{{cite web|author= |url=http://focusonthe615.com/2012/02/09/10-questions-with-a-thousand-horses/ |title=10 Questions With A Thousand Horses |publisher=FOCUS on the 615 |date=February 9, 2012 |access-date=July 13, 2015}} They enjoy writing their own original songs, but they occasionally collaborate with other writers around Nashville. They have toured nationwide and released their full-length album ''[[Southernality]]'' on January 21, 2015. ===''Bridges''=== Their "deluxe EP", ''Bridges'', was released on June 2, 2017,{{Cite news|url=http://www.cmt.com/news/1782216/a-thousand-horses-evolve-with-bridges/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170602225527/http://www.cmt.com/news/1782216/a-thousand-horses-evolve-with-bridges/|url-status=dead|archive-date=June 2, 2017|title=A Thousand Horses Evolve with Bridges|work=CMT News|access-date=July 5, 2017}} with [[Nashville Harbor Records & Entertainment]]. Producing the new CD with [[Dann Huff]] and [[Corey Crowder]], the band vowed to keep their unique sound intact. One of the featured songs on the record is a live version of their breakthrough hit "Smoke" recorded in [[Printer's Alley]].{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/a-thousand-horses-plot-return-with-new-release-bridges-127085/|title=A Thousand Horses Plot Return With New Release 'Bridges'|magazine=Rolling Stone|access-date=July 5, 2017}} ===''Southernality''=== Released June 9, 2015, ''[[Southernality]]'' is A Thousand Horses' debut album, released by [[Republic Nashville]]. The first single, "[[Smoke (A Thousand Horses song)|Smoke]]", has charted on [[Country Airplay]] and [[Hot Country Songs]], reaching number one on the former chart, making A Thousand Horses the first country group to chart a number-one debut single since the [[Zac Brown Band]]'s "[[Chicken Fried]]" reached number one in December 2008.{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/song/a-thousand-horses/6438813/smoke|title=Smoke|date=|publisher=Billboard|access-date=July 13, 2015}}{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/6583139/chart-highlights-taylor-swift-ties-record-as-bad-blood-hits-pop|title=Chart Highlights: Taylor Swift Ties Record as 'Bad Blood' Hits Pop Songs Top 10|last=Trust|first=Gary|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=June 1, 2015|access-date=June 2, 2015}} Reviews have been generally positive commending their smooth vocals, lyrics, and blend of country and rock.{{cite web|url=http://94country.com/2014/a-thousand-horses-smoke-song-review/|title=A Thousand Horses "Smoke" Song Review | The Big 94.5 Country|date=|publisher=94country.com|author=|access-date=July 13, 2015|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150714054937/http://94country.com/2014/a-thousand-horses-smoke-song-review/|archivedate=2015-07-14}} The album's second single, "[[(This Ain't No) Drunk Dial]]", was released to country radio on June 29, 2015. The album's third single, the title track, was released to country radio on February 29, 2016. ===''A Thousand Horses''=== {{quote box|quote="A high-energy hybrid of classic rock and bluesy country with enough soul flavor to resurrect the sound of American greats..."|source=Rolling Stone, 2014, ''Rolling Stone'' website.|width=250px}} Their debut E.P., ''A Thousand Horses'', was released on August 17, 2010, under [[Republic Nashville]]. It was recorded in six days in [[Silver Lake, Los Angeles|Silver Lake, California]], with producer [[Dave Cobb]]. The song "Suicide Eyes" from the E.P. was featured in the movie ''[[Footloose (2011 film)|Footloose]]'' starring [[Kenny Wormald]] and [[Julianne Hough]]. The director, Craig Brewer, found the song and knew that it fit the vibe for the movie. For their performance at the Austin City Limits festival in 2014, ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' hailed the band as the best up-and-comer, praising their "undeniable energy and stage presence [and] their live performance".{{cite web|last=Edwards |first=Gavin |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/lists/austin-city-limits-2014-country-music-performances-20141007/best-up-and-comer-a-thousand-horses-20141007/ |title=Best Up-and-Comer: A Thousand Horses - Austin City Limits 2014's Standout Performances |publisher=Rolling Stone |date=October 7, 2014 |access-date=July 13, 2015}} Zach Brown quit the band in 2023 to spend more time with family. A year later, the other three members released a new album titled ''The Outside'' on Highway Sound Records.{{cite web | url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-album-reviews/a-thousand-horses-the-outside-review-1235083065/ | title=A Thousand Horses Have Stopped Chasing Country Radio Hits. It Was a Good Decision | publisher=Rolling Stone | date=August 19, 2024 | accessdate=August 22, 2024 | author=Joseph Hudak}} ===Influences=== A Thousand Horses self-identifies as a hybrid of English rock, country, American rock, soul, and blues. Their sound mimics [[Lynyrd Skynyrd]], the [[Allman Brothers]], the [[Black Crowes]], and the [[Rolling Stones]] in the context of modern country. Hobby's songwriting is rooted in such songwriters as [[Dwight Yoakam]], [[Tom Petty]], and [[Noel Gallagher]].{{cite web|url=http://www.athousandhorses.com/ |title=Official Site |publisher=A Thousand Horses |date= |access-date=July 13, 2015}} ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:12em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:18em;"| Album details ! colspan="2"| Peak chart
